newsitem.title: POLAND: SWISS-GERMAN UNIT OPENS POLISH CARDBOARD PLANT.
newsitem.headline: SWISS-GERMAN UNIT OPENS POLISH CARDBOARD PLANT.

text.p: Big Carton company, owned by the Swiss Overseas Enterprises Ltd Co and an undisclosed Germany firm, opened in January a $20 million corrugated cardboard plant near the Polish city of Szczecin, the firm's president said.
Artur Burdasz told Reuters Big Carton wanted to invest a further $50-70 million in the plant, located in the small town of Kliniska, outside Szczecin in north-western Poland.
"In January we finished the first stage of investment in the cardboard factory outside Szczecin at the cost of $20 million and we will complete it with another $50-70 million," Burdasz said.
He said Big Carton wanted to build another corrugated cardbord factory over the next three years in central Poland, preferably near Warsaw at roughly the same cost and then a paper factory.
"Only the machines for the paper factory cost some $100 million, so the cost of the factory itself will be higher," he said.
Burdasz declined to name the German shareholder of Big Carton saying more details would be released at a news conference on February 22.
"Big Carton is 100 percent owned by Swiss-German capital with majority being Swiss," he said.
